data.name: vim.call
data.description:
Invokes |vim-function| or |user-function| {func} with arguments {...}.
        See also |vim.fn|.
        Equivalent to: >
            vim.fn[func]({...})

data.name: vim.cmd
data.description:
Invokes an Ex command (the ":" commands, Vimscript statements).
        See also |ex-cmd-index|.
        Example: >
            vim.cmd('echo 42')

data.name: vim.fn
data.description:
Invokes |vim-function| or |user-function| {func} with arguments {...}.
        To call autoload functions, use the syntax: >
            vim.fn['some#function']({...})
<
        Unlike vim.api.|nvim_call_function| this converts directly between Vim
        objects and Lua objects. If the Vim function returns a float, it will
        be represented directly as a Lua number. Empty lists and dictionaries
        both are represented by an empty table.

data.name: lua-vim-variables
data.description:
from Lua conveniently and idiomatically by referencing the `vim.*` Lua tables
described below. In this way you can easily read and modify global Vimscript
variables from Lua.

data.name: vim.g
data.description:
Global (|g:|) editor variables.
        Key with no value returns `nil`.

data.name: vim.b
data.description:
Buffer-scoped (|b:|) variables for the current buffer.
        Invalid or unset key returns `nil`.

data.name: vim.w
data.description:
Window-scoped (|w:|) variables for the current window.
        Invalid or unset key returns `nil`.

data.name: vim.t
data.description:
Tabpage-scoped (|t:|) variables for the current tabpage.
        Invalid or unset key returns `nil`.

data.name: vim.v
data.description:
|v:| variables.
        Invalid or unset key returns `nil`.

data.name: vim.env
data.description:
Environment variables defined in the editor session.
        See |expand-env| and |:let-environment| for the Vimscript behavior.
        Invalid or unset key returns `nil`.
        Example: >
            vim.env.FOO = 'bar'
            print(vim.env.TERM)
<

data.name: vim.o
data.description:
Get or set editor options, like |:set|. Invalid key is an error.
        Example: >
            vim.o.cmdheight = 4
            print(vim.o.columns)

data.name: vim.bo
data.description:
Get or set buffer-scoped |local-options|. Invalid key is an error.
        Example: >
            vim.bo.buflisted = true
            print(vim.bo.comments)

data.name: vim.wo
data.description:
Get or set window-scoped |local-options|. Invalid key is an error.
        Example: >
            vim.wo.cursorcolumn = true
            print(vim.wo.foldmarker)
